urbit-name.name: Urbit Name
urbit-name.description: Galaxy, star, and planet names in the Urbit computational metaverse.
urbit-name.author: urbit Project <urbit.org>
urbit-name.about:
This is just a playful implementation of Urbit names. Don't expect reliable or faithful
    results when compared to official implementation.


    More details [on Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/38139453/how-are-urbit-phonetic-names-encoded).

classify.name: Classify Text
classify.author: ttezel <https://github.com/ttezel/bayes>
classify.about:
The Classify Text column takes training data in the form of text values, and known categories for those text values. When it sees new text values without categories provided, it tries to infer the category based on the examples it's seen.

      **This is just a proof of concept. Because Glide does not guarantee that all columns are evaluated (it only evaluates columns required to show the current screen), this will usually not produce good results.**
classify.icon:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="48" height="48" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke="currentColor">
  <path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-width="2" d="M9 3v2m6-2v2M9 19v2m6-2v2M5 9H3m2 6H3m18-6h-2m2 6h-2M7 19h10a2 2 0 002-2V7a2 2 0 00-2-2H7a2 2 0 00-2 2v10a2 2 0 002 2zM9 9h6v6H9V9z" />
</svg>

pad.name: Pad Text
pad.description: Pads string on the left and right sides if it's shorter than length. Padding characters are truncated if they can't be evenly divided by length.

</svg>

text-length.name: Text Length
text-length.description: Gets the length of a text snippet
text-length.author: Glide <hello@glideapps.com>
text-length.icon:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="48" height="48" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke="currentColor">

</svg>

text-index.name: Text Offset
text-index.description: Gets the zero-based offset of the zero-based N-th occurence of needle in haystack
text-index.author: Glide <hello@glideapps.com>
text-index.icon:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="48" height="48" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke="currentColor">

</svg>

text-slice.name: Text Slice
text-slice.description: Gets a substring out of text, from zero-indexed "start" with an optional length
text-slice.author: Glide <hello@glideapps.com>
text-slice.icon:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="48" height="48" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke="currentColor">
  <path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-width="2" d="M9 12h6m-6 4h6m2 5H7a2 2 0 01-2-2V5a2 2 0 012-2h5.586a1 1 0 01.707.293l5.414 5.414a1 1 0 01.293.707V19a2 2 0 01-2 2z" />
</svg>

text-to-emoji.name: Text to Emoji
text-to-emoji.description: Get an emoji from a piece of text
text-to-emoji.author: IonicaBizau <https://github.com/IonicaBizau/emoji-from-text#readme>

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="48" height="48" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke="currentColor">

truncate.name: Truncate Text
truncate.description: Truncates a string if it is longer than the specified number of characters. Truncated strings will end with a translatable ellipsis sequence ("…").
truncate.author: HubSpot <https://github.com/HubSpot/humanize>
truncate.icon:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="48" height="48" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke="currentColor">

</svg>
